remarks: Define the cardinal number function.  The cardinal number of a set is the least ordinal number equinumerous to it.  In other words, it is the "size" of the set.  Definition of [Enderton] p. 197.  See ~ cardval for its value, ~ cardval2 for a simpler version of its value.  The principle theorem relating cardinality to equinumerosity is ~ carden .  Our notation is from Enderton.  Other textbooks often use a double bar over the set to express this function.  (Contributed by NM, 21-Oct-2003.)
statement:
df-card $p |- card = ( x e. _V |-> |^| { y e. On | y ~~ x } ) $.
$d x y $.
